getPersistanceData

public short getPersistanceData()

getPieceFromPersistanceData

public static Piece getPieceFromPersistanceData(short persistanceData,
                                                ChessBoard board)
                                         throws InvalidPosition
Parameters:
persistanceData - the bits to read piece information from
From left, first 4 bits row, 4 bits column and then 8 bits type (where only the four rightmost is used)
board - the board the piece is going to be placed on
Returns:
a newly constructed piece
Throws:
InvalidPosition

Parameters:

removeMoveListener

public void removeMoveListener(MoveListener listener)

addMoveChain

protected void addMoveChain(int rowChange,
                            int columnChange,
                            byte movesToGenerate)
Utility function that adds a chain of moves that this piece can do

Parameters:
rowChange - the increment(positive)/decrement(negative) for each step
columnChange - the increment(right)/decrement(left) for each step
movesToGenerate - number of moves to generate

addPossibleMoves

public abstract void addPossibleMoves()
Add the theoretically possible moves for this piece to the internal move list for this piece (Automatically called from the constructor)

getPossibleMoves

public ArrayList<Move> getPossibleMoves()
Returns:
a list of "in theory" possible moves that this piece can make

getAvailableMoves

public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<Move> getAvailableMoves(boolean sort,
                                                                       ChessBoard board)
Returns the cached evaluation of all the possible moves for this piece and excludes the ones that aren't possible at the moment Override this method if you want to optimize it for a specific piece

Parameters:
sort - true if the returned map should be ordered by the moves take over value
board -
Returns:
the available moves for this piece on the supplied board and within it's bounds ordered by their take over value

getNonAvailableMoves

public List<Move> getNonAvailableMoves(ChessBoard board)
Returns the cached evaluation of all the possible moves for this piece and excludes the ones that are possible at the moment Override this method if you want to optimize it for a specific piece

Parameters:
board -
Returns:
the non available moves for this piece on the supplied board and within it's bounds ordered by their take over value

                                        ChessBoard board)

pos -
board -
Returns:
an available move if one was found, otherwise null meaning that this piece can't move into the given position

getAffinity

public boolean getAffinity()
Returns:
true if this piece is black, false if it's white

performMove

public void performMove(Move move,
                        ChessBoard board)
                 throws UnavailableMoveException
Moves this Piece with the supplied move.

Parameters:
move - the move to apply to this piece
Throws:
UnavailableMoveException - if this move isn't available right now (Note that this will be misleading if there are ChessBoardListener's that performs another move when nextPlayer is called)

performMove

public void performMove(Move move,
                        ChessBoard board,
                        boolean printOut)
                 throws UnavailableMoveException
Moves this Piece with the supplied move.

Parameters:
move - the move to apply to this piece
printOut - true if there should be print outs about the move to the standard out stream
Throws:
UnavailableMoveException - if this move isn't available right now (Note that this will be misleading if there are ChessBoardListener's that performs another move when nextPlayer is called)
